instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00840: What is 820-00840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_G3H: What is PP3V3_G3H? PP3V3_G3H is a 3.3v power line that is present when the machine is in a Global System Hardware Off state, and should come on before most other rails so that the USB-C circuitry can be powered for the charger.
definitions.SMC_LID_RIGHT: What is SMC_LID_RIGHT? SMC_LID_RIGHT is a signal that tells the system if the lid is closed from the right LID sensor. If it is low, the system thinks the lid is closed – if it is 3.3v, the system thinks the machine is open. SMC_LID_RIGHT needs to be high for the machine to stay awake and have a backlight. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A wount wake from sleep
threads.message:
The macbook is efi locked , so I worked on the bin file to remove the password, then I installed monteri os. Everything worked well
Except that it wount wake from sleep either by closing the lid or when it’s sleeps it’s self. 
it will come up either through  smc reset or when I remover the battery.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A wount wake from sleep
threads.message: Check the signals from Hall sensors.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A wount wake from sleep
threads.message:
3.414 on hall sensor pin7
3.415 on pin6
It’s like it doesn’t goes to sleep instead it shots down
The current on the ammeter goes to zero when closing the lid or when it goes to sleep itself

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A wount wake from sleep
threads.message:
There are two Hall sensors.
One is connected to J6600.
Post <CHIP>U5255</CHIP> voltages, if possible.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A wount wake from sleep
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A wount wake from sleep
threads.message:
"Pin 1 <SIGNAL>SMC_LID_RIGHT</SIGNAL> 0.014v"
Need to fix this problem.

As per schematic, right Hall sensor is on the audio flex.
A fast bypass solution, is to remove <RESISTOR>R5257</RESISTOR> and join pins 1 & 2 of <CHIP>U5255</CHIP>.
Changing audio flex is still the recommended option.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A wount wake from sleep
